Header: Sarasaviya Film Awards ceremony held in grand scale
Content: The 34th Sarasavi Awards Ceremony took place in a grand scale under the patronage of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe. The Sarasavi Award Ceremony was held yesterday at the BMICH in Colombo. The ceremony had been named in recognition of Late Film Director Dr. Lester James Peiris. The Lake House organized the ceremony. Cargills was the main sponsor of the event. ITN was the media sponsor of the ceremony. 50 awards were presented at the ceremony for 2016 and 2017. Thisuri Yuwanika won the Best Upcoming Actress award for 2017. Dineth de Silva won the Best Upcoming Actors award for 2017. Pooja Umashanker won the Best Actresses award for 2017 the film “Visi Ata” was adjudged the Best Film in 2017. The Music Direction Award for 2017 was won by Dr. Rohana Weerasinghe. Kushani Sandarekha received the Best Female Singer’s Award for “Aadaraniya Kathawak” 2016. Vidusha Nethranjali  won the Best Female Singer’s award for “Ali Kathawa film in 2017. On behalf of Motorbicycalaya film Ajith Kumarasiri received the Best Singer’s award for 2016. Dumal Warnakulasuriya was adjudged the Best Singer for 2017 for the film “Premaya”. Sumithra Peiris was presented with Dr. Lester James Peiris Sinamabhimani Award. Professor Dias Gunaratne received 2017 Ranapala Bodhinagoda Cinema Literacy Commemorative Award.  2017 Ranathisara Award was won by Sriyani Amarasena and Robin Fernando received the Ranathisara Award for 2016. Speaker Karu Jayasuriya, Minister Mangala Samaraweera, State Minister Iran Wickremaratne, Deputy Ministers Lasantha Alagiyawanna and Ranjan Ramanayake were present at the ceremony.
